bibl.title: in collaboration with A.D.E. LEWIS (Edd.), Legal Documents of the Hellenistic World. Papers from a Seminar arranged by the Institute of Classical Studies, the Institute of Jewish Studies and the Warburg Institute, University of London, February to May 1986.
bibl.note: A series of eight seminars. The aim was to compare the evidence of our legal texts in Greek, Egyptian (Demotic), Akkadian, and Aramaic in order to establish analogies, differences, and their reasons. Concerning Hellenistic Egypt, see the contributions by Willy CLARYSSE, Ranon KATZOFF, Joseph MÉLÈZE-MODRZEJEWSKI, P.W. PESTMAN, and Reinhold SCHOLL.
